 Describes the allocation of physical pages. More...

Detailed Description

Implements the physical page management.

This class manages the physical pages of the programs which run on the top of the Nachos kernel. It keeps track of which physical pages are used and which are free.

It processes a new page demand by applying the clock algorithm when there is no page available. It requires an access to the thread list in order to choose which page will be swapped using the SwapManager class.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PhysicalMemManager::PhysicalMemManager (   ) 
 

initialize the memory manager

Constructor. It simply clears all the page flags and inserts them in the free_page_list to indicate that the physical pages are free

de-allocate the page_flags bitmap

int PhysicalMemManager::find_free_page (   )  [private]
 

This method returns a new physical page number, if it finds one free. If not, return -1. Does not run the clock algorithm.

Returns:
A new free physical page number.

int PhysicalMemManager::get_new_page (  TranslationTable *  owner,
int  virtualPage
) 
 

return the number of a new page

This method returns a new physical page number. If there is no page available, it applies the clock algorithm to determinate the page among the physical ones to put in the swapping area.

Parameters:
owner translation table of the owner (for backlink)
virtualPage is the number of virtualPage to link with physical page
Returns:
A new physical page number.

void PhysicalMemManager::release_page (  int  num_page  ) 
 

release the page which number is num_page

This method releases an unused physical page by clearing the corresponding bit in the page_flags bitmap structure, and adding it in the free_page_list

Parameters:
num_page is the number of the real page to free
